etymology.description: 好(好) (hǎo, "very") + 久(久) (jiǔ, "long time") + 不(不) (bù, "not") + 见(見) (jiàn, "see"). This phrase is used when meeting someone after not having seen them for a while.
etymology.interpretation: 好久不见(好久不見) (hǎojiǔ bújiàn, "long time no see") is a greeting used when you meet someone again after a long period has passed. It conveys the idea of being pleased to see each other after a long absence, reflecting friendliness and warmth.

examples.chinese: 你今天来了(你今天來了)，好久不见(好久不見)。
examples.english: You have come today, long time no see.

examples.chinese: 我们好久不见(我們好久不見)。
examples.english: Long time no see, we haven't met for ages.

examples.chinese: 老朋友(老朋友)，好久不见(好久不見)！
examples.english: Old friend, long time no see!
